intro: Pachylophus marginatus, commonly known as the marginated thick-leaf plant, is a species of flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves that are adapted to retain moisture in arid environments. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists studying plant adaptations to extreme climates.
